com.ibm.mqttsample.utility
Class SubPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.SubPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class SubPanel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

This class creates a panel that contains all the components to do with subscribing for and receiving publications.

Constructor Summary
SubPanel(javax.swing.JPanel theSubPanel, MQTTFrame aMqttMgr)
          The constructor for the subscription panel

Listen out for the Subscribe button, Unsubscribe button, Save button or the Hex/Text button being pressed

Updating the drop down boxes with the topic if necessary Subscribing / Unsubscribing for the data
Processing the Save button involves poping up a file dialog, opening the file, writing the data and closing the file.

Constructor Detail

SubPanel

public SubPanel(javax.swing.JPanel theSubPanel,
                MQTTFrame aMqttMgr)
The constructor for the subscription panel

Parameters:
theSubPanel - The JPanel component into which all other components are placed
aMqttMgr - The MQIsdpFrame object through which WMQtt communication is done.
Method Detail

init

public void init()
The init method builds all the required components and adds them to the subscription panel. Different layout managers are used throughout to ensure that the components resize correctly as the window resizes.

updateTopicList

public boolean updateTopicList(java.lang.String topicName)
For any requests to add a topic to the publish drop down box use the updateComboBoxList method in class MQIsdpFrame to do the job.

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
ActionListener interface
Listen out for the Subscribe button, Unsubscribe button, Save button or the Hex/Text button being pressed
Subscribing / Unsubscribing for data involves:
  • Updating the drop down boxes with the topic if necessary
  • Subscribing / Unsubscribing for the data

Processing the Save button involves poping up a file dialog, opening the file, writing the data and closing the file.
Processing the Hex/Text button presses involves converting the display between a text character representation and hexadecimal character representation.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

updateReceivedData

public void updateReceivedData(java.lang.String topic,
                               byte[] data,
                               int QoS,
                               boolean retained)
This method is passed a received publication. It then:
  • Switches the display to text if was in hex display mode
  • Updates the display with the new data
  • Switches the display back to hex if was originally in hex display mode
  • Writes a log entry to the history window

enableButtons

public void enableButtons(boolean b)
This enables or disables the subscribe and unsubscribe buttons depending on the value of the boolean.

Parameters:
b - Button enabled if true, otherwise disabled.
